results.content: Very good course to learn Rails, I am new and starting to get the hang of it, wish there was more starter courses like this or project added
results.content_html: Very good course to learn Rails, I am new and starting to get the hang of it, wish there was more starter courses like this or project added

results.content: First lesson didn't give me a global idea about the rails tool. I followed instructions, had a looooot of issues on my mac to install things so I had to search a lot to solve it, made the deploy, but in the end, I feel I did a lot of things, but nothing that really had to do with rails. I'll see how it goes in the next sections.

results.content: Amazing course with a pretty good explanation about everything. I recommend for who is looking to ruby on rails
results.content_html: Amazing course with a pretty good explanation about everything. I recommend for who is looking to ruby on rails

results.content:
This is an excellent introductory course to Ruby on Rails 6. I can recommend it without reservation.

I think it contains everything that should be included in an introductory course and more.

The instructor presented the material quite well. Kudos.

response.content: Thank you for the 5-stars, it means a lot.
response.content_html: Thank you for the 5-stars, it means a lot.

results.content: The course is great and all but the teacher doesn't answer our questions about problems we come across when we follow along their lectures.

response.content:
Hi Katie,
Apologies for being out of touch as I had some time away. I am working through student questions and will have a response to you shortly.
Thanks,
Tony.

results.content: I am just in the firsts classes but I am really happy with de content. It looks like its just what I was looking for: A step by step rails course, well explained and easy to follow even I one doesn't have any previous experience with coding.

results.content: i am working on Linux based system, but it doesn't matter  i want to switch on good package so this course is helpful to me. I can't understand git hub, node js and yarn. I am working on sublime.

response.content:
Hi Vineet,

All of the code shown in each lecture will wok with Sublime. The use of Github is optional.

Hope this helps,
Tony.
